isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 25-SI SERIES, TYPES 400 AND 450 - REPAIR PROCEDURES - REASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLY

important.para: Before installing thru-bolts, apply a small coating of thread lock adhesive (General Purpose Lock N' Seal No. 242 or equivalent) to the threads. This will prevent the bolts from backing out during operation.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 8 for all item number callouts in parentheses.

step1.para: Fasten the drive end frame (Item 15, Figure 8) to the rectifier end frame (Item 16) using the through bolts (Item 18). Tighten thru-bolts to 55 in.- lbs. (6 N•m).

caution.para: Do not over-tighten bolt or adapter. Excessive tightening could damage the heat sink.

step1.para: Make sure the two field coil leads are connected to the regulator.
Verify placement of leads. Check that they are in the following order on each stud; two diode leads, stator lead, "R" terminal lead (on one stud only), then regulator lead and nut.
Install a new gasket (Item 3) then attach the cover (Item 2) and cover plate (Item 1).

Attach pulley and fan (Item 19). To assist in tightening the drive pulley nut (Item 21), a hexagon hole is provided in the end of the rotor shaft for holding with an Allen wrench. Tighten pulley nut to 70-80 lb. ft. (95-108 N•m).

Attach output terminals to alternator. Two types of output terminals have been used on this series alternator. One design features an output terminal bolt with an insulated head. The other design has a terminal bolt and adapter with an insulating boot. Either type bolt as well as the adapter should be tightened to 100-110 in-lbs. (11-12 N•m). Magnetize the rotor. Refer to
MAGNETIZING THE ROTOR.

To check output, connect test meters as shown in Figure 4and test as instructed under
TROUBLESHOOTING.
